meanings.definition: A slap on the back as a gesture of congratulation or encouragement.
meanings.sent1: After winning the game, he received a friendly backslap from his teammates.
meanings.sent2: During the celebration, there were many backslaps exchanged among the team.
meanings.sent3: The backslap he got after his speech made him feel proud and appreciated.
meanings.sent4: The backslap of approval from his coach motivated him to keep improving.
meanings.sent5: The loud backslap echoed in the locker room, signifying their victory.

meanings.definition: To slap someone on the back in a congratulatory or encouraging manner.
meanings.sent1: He would backslap his friends after a job well done.
meanings.sent2: The coach backslapped each player as they left the field.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to backslap him if he didn't stop teasing her.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the backslap resonated through the room, showing his support.
meanings.sent5: With a firm backslap, he congratulated his friend on the promotion.
